sub_title: (International) Project Manager / Project Leader/ Business Development/ Program Coordinator
summary:
20+ years of work experience, working for multinationals and leading companies (Logitech, Ecorys, Springer, Datri (telecom)).  Titles held to date include (International) Program Coordinator, (International) Project Manager, Project Leader, and more recently, Business Developer. 

Quick learner of various business sectors and processes.  Each role requires strong stakeholder management to ensure the desired outcome. Teamwork is essential in each of my roles which lead to the successful completion of projects, programs, and customer solutions.

Results-focused with strong communication and problem-solving skills and a hands-on approach. Positive with an opportunity mindset.

projects.title: Lot 11.1232 - Technical Assistance to prepare the Public Finance Management Annual Monitoring Report 2014 Bhutan
projects.description:
EU Delegation of Bhutan
The global objective of this assignment is to describe and evaluate the progress of the performance of the public financial management system of the Royal Government of Bhutan in order to establish eligibility for the provision of budget support to Bhutan.
The specific objective of the assignment is to prepare a Draft PFM Annual Monitoring Report 2014 for Bhutan, which strictly follows the EU template as given in Annex 2 of these terms of references, including an assessment of the transparency and oversight of the national budget.

projects.title: Lot 11 - PEFA based assessment of Greenland
projects.description:
EU Delegation Greenland (Denmark)
The global objective of the study is to perform a PEFA (public expenditure and financial accountability) based assessment of the quality, transparency, accountability, and effectiveness of public finance management (PFM) in Greenland. 

Specific objectives: 
In the short-term, a PEFA assessment may be used as baseline data, and as a basis for information and monitoring so as to: (i) facilitate and update the dialogue on PFM between Government of Greenland and the donors; (ii) help donors assess eligibility for budget support programmes; (iii) recommend specific elements in the PFM for improvement and the medium term target to achieve; (iv) recommend the intermediary annual targets for these specific elements in order to achieve these specific improvements.

In the medium-term, the PEFA assessment may contribute to reflections on: (i) the preparation or revision of a PFM reform strategy (and related action plan); (ii) the preparation or revision of a PFM capacity development programme, in coordination with the Government of Greenland.

projects.title: Lot 11 - TA for PEFA Assessment on Armenia in 2013
projects.description:
EU Delegation Armenia
The overall objective of the contract is to provide Technical Assistance to assess the PFM systems of Armenia in 2013 by applying the PEFA methodology. 
The specific objective of the contract is to facilitate the role of the Ministry of Finance of the Government of the Republic of Armenia to carry out a self-assessment of the PFM systems using the PEFA methodology, specifically by ensuring the consistent use of the "PEFA Check approach"

projects.title: Lot 11 - A study of contingent liabilities in Tanzania
projects.description:
EU Delegation Tanzania
The purpose of the study is to establish the magnitude and potential of contingent liabilities becoming actual liabilities for the Government of Tanzania (GoT) and the associated fiscal risks. The study will propose a set of short and medium term actions for discussion and implementation by Government.

profile_positions.title: Business Development Video Collaboration Benelux
Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
Project management of Framework Contracts of the European Commission in various areas amongst which: Macro Economy, Statistics and Public Finance Management (Lot 11),  Education, Employment, and Social Inclusion & Protection (Lot 9), Health (Lot 8), Transportation (Lot 2), Department for International Development (DfID), etc. 
A Framework contract is an instrument for fast and transparent recruiting of experts for activities in the sole interest of the beneficiary countries/authorities of the European Commission’s external aid programs. 

▪ Lead the executing framework team of awarded projects;
▪ Acquire, monitor, evaluate and analyze requested services including budget & finance analyses;
▪ Project management of won projects and ensuring a successful completion within the EC rules, timeline and budget; 
▪ Recruitment, assessment and selection of teams for each project,
▪ Contact point between the experts, EC, beneficiaries and consortium partners,
▪ Annual reporting to all parties involved, 
▪ Expand professional networking, create business opportunities and maintain current relationships,
▪ Trained and mentored new colleagues and student assistants. 

✔ Projects awarded and managed internationally.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
▪ Initiated, coordinated, implemented, supported, tracked and reported projects in a timely manner in close liaison with colleagues from various departments and locations within the company.
▪ Responsible for a publishing program based on STM and B2B products of journals and books.
▪ Provided a high level of attention to detail and logistics combined with the ability to deal with complex and multiple projects simultaneously.
▪ Mentored new support staff in line with company strategy and procedures.
▪ Served as the company’s ambassador at national and international conferences and meetings.
▪ Sustained and grew network (researchers and professionals mainly affiliated with societies, associations, governments and high quality institutions and professional businesses) by maintaining and acquiring new projects.
profile_positions.title: Program Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
First Street is dedicated to enriching the lives of developmentally disabled adults through art education and provides the resources necessary for their clients to become independent working artists. 

▪ Spearheaded and founded new job program in a non-profit institution for artists to collaborate with local businesses funded by grants.
▪ Fostered community instruction in social skills, self-advocacy, activities of daily living, communication and job-related skills for the artists.
profile_positions.title: Job Coach / Public Relations

profile_positions.description:
▪ Worked part-time organizing and implementing campus events and activities for up to 1,000 students in coordination with local businesses and various bodies of the college.
▪ Determined need for events and services within the budget, space and time available.
profile_positions.title: Event Coordinator
